items.title: Oliver Glasner to leave Crystal Palace in summer, Manchester City close on Gu√©hi: football ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ The latest football news going into the weekend ‚öΩ Premier League preview | Follow on Bluesky | Mail us A very poor 9/15 from me. Afcon is moving to a four-year cycle, a decision the Confederation of African Football has been accused of forcing through without proper consultation. Ed Aarons and Romain Molina report: Several presidents of African football federations have told the Guardian they were not informed of the decision until it was surprisingly announced by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, on 20 December, prompting claims that the confederation breached its statutes by failing to seek approval at a general assembly. items.title: Glasner to leave Palace at end of season

items.title: Boots from Easter Bunny and teenage parties - Glasner tells his story

items.title: Van Persie is zijn glimlach kwijt: 'Bij Feyenoord moet je veel meer winnen'
items.summary: Het is crisis bij Feyenoord, en dat weet trainer Robin van Persie maar al te goed. De normaal zo goedlachse Rotterdammer is ronduit ontevreden over de huidige clubsituatie en vond het misplaatst om met een glimlach op de persconferentie te verschijnen. 'Dat is in deze setting niet gepast.'

items.title: Glasner verlaat Crystal Palace deze zomer
items.summary: Oliver Glasner heeft bevestigd dat hij bezig is aan zijn laatste maanden als manager van Crystal Palace. De Oostenrijker beschikt over een aflopend contract en gaat dat niet verlengen.

items.title: Van Persie vertelt hoe lang Read 'out' is en is positief over Moder en Nieuwkoop
items.summary: Robin van Persie heeft vrijdagmiddag een medische update over de selectie van Feyenoord gegeven. Op de persconferentie in aanloop naar de derby tegen Sparta Rotterdam ging hij in op onder anderen Bart Nieuwkoop, Jakub Moder en Givairo Read.

items.title: Glasner to leave Palace at end of season: 'I want a new challenge'
items.summary: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner has revealed he will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season, citing his desire for a "new challenge" after nearly two years at Selhurst Park.

items.title: Liverpool consider drafting Mo Salah straight back into squad for Marseille trip
items.summary: Forward due to fly back from Afcon on Sunday Liverpool play Champions League game on Wednesday Liverpool are in talks with Mohamed Salah over the forward making an immediate return to Arne Slot‚Äôs squad for their Champions League trip to Marseille next week. Salah is due back at Liverpool after Egypt‚Äôs involvement in the Africa Cup of Nations ends on Saturday. Egypt face Nigeria in a third-place play-off in Casablanca after suffering another loss to a Sadio Man√©-inspired Senegal in the semi-finals. The 33-year-old Salah travelled to Morocco with uncertainty surrounding his future having accused the club of throwing him ‚Äúunder the bus‚Äù after a poor run of results and claiming he no longer had a relationship with Slot. Liverpool are unbeaten in the 11 matches since Slot first dropped Salah at West Ham. Continue reading...

items.title: McIlroy loses lead in Dubai after error-strewn second day
items.summary: Rory McIlroy found water four times during an error-strewn second round at the Dubai Invitational as the world No 2 lost his lead with a three-over 74.

Everyone at the club is excited to have her at Manchester United and the opportunity to help maximise her potential.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: 'If I had 15 attackers I'd be happy to have Salah back'
items.summary: Mohamed Salah returns to Liverpool next week with boss Arne Slot saying he would be pleased to have the forward back even if he had "15 attackers".
